content.description: Another long fun maple canyon route.
content.location: in between min mediation and meet the buddha.

content.description:
This route climbs very similarly to Zen Fen and is on similar rock. While it has been tapped with a hammer, kicked and brushed quite a bit, do not expect it to be as clean and buffed as its classic neighbor is as it has not had the many thousands of ascents Zen Fen has had....yet.  At the time of posting, this route has had about 10 ascents.

With traffic, I expect this route to get a bit easier, and it will become buffed and as fun as its excellent left hand neighbor is.
content.protection: Seven 1/2" stainless bolts to a mussy hook anchor.
content.location: The farthest right route on the main portion of Zen Garden.  Starts just left of the big tree and about 10 feet right of Zen Fen.   It is a completely independent line with its own anchor.

content.description: Great route on the usual Maple Conglomerate.
content.location: Right most route when facing the wall.

content.description: Crux is near the bottom and then pulling the roof.  Which can be avoided if you go right.
content.location: 100 yards past the main zen garden wall.  There's a "trail" that goes around instead of going up the steep part close to the wall.  Only bolted route over there.

content.description: Hard start to a sustained rest of the climb.
content.location: First bolted route right of Samsora.

content.description: Pretty sustained climb with some crimpy holds that aren't so easy to find.  Kinda short but fun climb.
content.location: This is the climb right of Buddah belly.  They share the same belay ledge and can be top roped with a directional off of the last bolt

content.description: Long fun maple canyon climb shady in the morning.
content.location: Really close the the tree, careful of the swing and lowering that you don't run into it.

content.description: The crux is really getting to the chains from the sixth bolt.  Incredible line.
content.location: One line left of Zen Fen.

content.description: Sort of weird route, the crux passing the first bolt.
content.location: Left most route on the main wall, starting just above the landing created by the log wedged between two trees.

content.description: We originally thought this formation looked like Mickey Mouse Ears, but after all the national monument controversy we decided Bears Ears was more appropriate.    A fun sport route past 13 glue-ins that should be a popular lead.   Climb through the lower face to a no hands rest before the crux bulge up high.  A few hard cranks past 3 bolts in the upper face will get you to the anchors.  Pretty much follows the black streak up the middle of the formation the whole way. 60m rope.
content.location:
This route is included in the Zen Garden section, but is actually on the front face of the Zen formation before you get to the Zen Garden wall itself.  The Zen Garden is around the corner to the left.

After passing the Minimum crag, head towards Zen Garden but look for a short 20' approach trail that leads to the base of this route.   The Bears Ears formation is easily identifiable on the main trail and the route climbs more-or-less up the black streak between the "ears."
